dhp1:1: "Mano" here is clearly being used in its ordinary sense of meaning "mind." Similarly, "dhammā" here has its broadest meaning - that is, all phenomena.
dhp1:2: This line clearly establishes the concept that ultimately everything is mind - a concept which later become a critical lynchpin in the development of Mahāyāna philosophy. In an attempt to escape this inescapable fact, some translators have chosen to entirely rewrite this passage.
